name: Crusaders of the Lost Idols
description: Crusaders of the Lost Idols is an idle game of heroic awesomeness! Create a band of fighters to fight monsters, earn gold and create strategies for the perfect formations over multiple campaigns! Upgrade your heroes, collect unique gear, and unlock new Crusaders in regular new events.
minimum_requirements: OS: Microsoft® Windows Server 2008, Windows 7, or Windows 8 Classic Processor: 2.33GHz or faster x86-compatible processor, or Intel Atom™ 1.6GHz or faster processor for netbook class devices Memory: 512 MB RAM Storage: 120 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Really a fantastic clicker/idle game. Though, in actuality, it's a lot more than that. It's much more engaging than any other idle game I've played in the past, completely addictive, and trailblazing. Sure, it takes all the elements from other games that I've loved, but this adds so many new twists and turns that just seem to fit right in, and really feel like they belong. It makes it its own, and turns it into something completely new, refreshing, and fun! The chatroom is gorgeous, a great thing to have, so even if I'm sitting at my PC idlilng, I can still hang out with friends, meet new people, chat strategies etc. I love this game!

A different take on the click/idle genre. Quite enjoyable. Arranging your characters into formation to maximize DPS output is quite a bit of fun.   They just patched it so you can merge multiple accounts, so all the negative reviews crying about greedy devs not merging the saves are invalid now.
An awersome little idle game, with good developers , that update a lot and make new events .

Crusaders of the Lost Idols is a clicker game, well, unless you're recruiting characters that will deal damage for you. Set in a fantasy world, your goal is to pass through levels, with your party which is moving by itself and with enemies coming to you. Complete the quest of the level to access the next one. Every five levels, you get a boss to kill, which gives a chest. The latter hides cards with permanent bonus, new gears, new clothes or buffs to use during a quest.  The money you're collecting will serve to upgrade your characters, to recruit new ones or to unlock new abilities. Some of them are specific to your character, others will affect those next or in front of you while special ones will be used during the levels. In other words, each character can be useful.... if only you weren't stuck to 10 characters maximum.  That's the core of this free-to-play. Only chests are for now a paying item if you want to advance faster.  The graphics are quite cheerful and colorful, the soundtrack is nice. I must say that you don't need an account somewhere to play it. However, you can play it elsewhere and link both accounts.  I'm just disappointed that in-game achievements aren't counted here. Apparently, you need to reset the world (where you don't loose your acquired trinkets for example) so that Steam is considering that achievements can be unlocked. I don't know as I need to reach the requirements for it.  Anyway, the game is surprisingly addictive and simple to handle. Cards are just bonus, you don't have to build a deck, which is a relief for me. Given the fact that it's free, without account to make, give it a shot. Be warned though, you may find it slow without chests. I could enjoy the potential of this game thanks to orly and its key giveaway.  EDIT: I had to uninstall the game - apparently, it was causing a problem with launching games freshly updated or uploaded.

Interesting concept, seems to have a lot of content. As it is right now (beta), it’s not for me though.  While I enjoy Time Clickers and Clicker Heroes, this game has a lot more micro-management - which I do not enjoy. With all the items and stat boosts its also a lot more complex/intransparent.  I can see others enjoying this though, so - even though I did not enjoy it - I give it my recommendation.

Best Idle game available on steam, I've been playing this game for about 7 days on kongregate and damn it's great. Pros: -> Innovative idle game experience -> You got daily missions wich give you Red Rubies. -> Strategy involved, wich means diferent formations wich equals to diferent ways of playstyles. -> * You can't move to next level till you get enought dps (or click damage) like clicker heroes. -> Equipments, Exp & Trinkets to boost your crusaders dps and gold find. -> Good amount of buffs. -> Monthly events. Cons: -> 1st world reset takes about 2 days (time to get involved with the game). -> No 'multiplayer', i would love to see some kind of system where you can help your friends or something like that. -> No Auto level forward (on steam version only)  What needs to be added to the game? (My opinion) -> Weekly and mothly quests. -> More ways of using rubies. -> 5 daily quests total, being able to purchase 1 chest per day. -> Login bonus. -> Clickables, reason: if i want to farm gold to go up a level i just leave the game open farming chests. But if im playing the game it could at least give me a bit of a bonus.

I like this game a lot, mainly because I can let it run while doing other things, but also because when I am offline I can still make progress through missions and collect coins to level up the crussdaers.  I play Buskwhacker 2, also by Codename, but based on the web. I didn't start playing Crusaders until I downloaded Steam.

SO definetely go for it and you' ll get stuck !!!

Highly recommeneded! 10/10

After playing this game for just a few hours, I can say you will be way to addicted for no reason. It's simple and fun.

Pretty interesting 'idle' game due to the added strategy of formations. You start off with 20 free heroes. There are about 30 event heroes that were released in previous events, but it is nigh impossible to recruit them and gear them up in time because it takes 13 days to attempt a quest to recruit 1 new hero and 90 days to attempt quests to gear up that hero, and with the quest success rates being around 50%, you can see it will easily take more than half a year to get one usable event hero. There are 30 of them. The other option is to pay money to buy special event chests to get the gear you need for them. I wish that they would add new free ways to recruit these event heroes that won't require half a year playtime per hero.
I have a unboxing on my Youtube channel and it say's some stuff about the game, and they are positive things =D   Here it is =)          YouTube™ Video:  Crusaders of the Lost Idols Chest Unboxing!

I'm a big cellphone gamer, from Mandrake Girls Garden of Magic, to Neko Atsume, to Cat Battles, I'm kind of all over cell phone games. So, knowing this factoid you can better understand why I LOVE this game. Its easy to have run in the background and check periodically, requires very little from the player themselves, so I just watch anime and check the game every once in a while. It's a fun game that I can walk away from or, when stoned, stare at for hours. I adore this game and totally reccomend it as long as youre not expecting some super hella FPS craziness.

It has events that you can buy chests for the characters you're able to unlock but isnt required. Easy to make gems and side missions that reward other things like chests, characters, gold, and buffs. Great Game!

Out of all the clicker/idle games I've played (Clicker Heroes, Adventure Capitalist, Time Clickers and Tap Tap Infinity) I am pleased with the progrees in the genre this game has made. Along with choosing characters and equipping them with gear; the player has the option of many different quests to partake in after resetting the world. Some quest runs require an amount of strategy, while others are just level runs. There are different formations in each quest tier for the characters to be placed in as well. On top of the frequent updates, there are seasonal challenges to partake in. While fun, they are limited to a few days and if you're not quite up there in experience, you'll only be able to make it past the first two missions in the quest. Idol collection is a big part of the game and the player cannot proceed far without obtaining a fair amount. It's a grind but I find it to be pleasant. Overall, I would say it's a new take on an increasingly popular gaming genre. With RPG elements added; it's definitely worth trying it out. You should know within the first hour or less if it's something you'll enjoy.  8/10
Cool clicker game, new king of idle games.

Best idle game. Lots of heroes to choose from, lots of formations to play in your own style, laborious devs who provide new content every week.

At first, the game seems daunting, with the whole Formation and Gear system. But once you get into it, it's really quite a relaxing game. You can just autopilot through runs, like in Clicker Heroes.   But UNLIKE Clicker Heroes, you don't have to use a third party calculator to ensure you're actually progressing due to the Ancient/Souls system punishing you for you know,  spending your hard earned Souls.  That, along with the frequent events, varied Missions that change up the gameplay and a constant sense of progression help make this game feel like you're actually accomplishing something.   Give it a shot at least. After all, it's free!

I really like this game, it's a refreshing change to Clicker Heroes. There are many classes that actually specialize in certain things, and give you the ability to create a loadout of heroes to properly deal with any situation you come across.  The 'quests' for each level are straightforward, and the 'objectives' help you gain gems, the in-game currency pretty quickly, for any Clicker veterans.  In the end, this is a great free-to-play and I'd definitely suggest it to anyone looking for a new Clicker experience.

Oooh, this game is a lot of fun.  I've been playing Clicker Heroes for hundreds of hours and figured I'd check out a new clicker game.  Great execution of the clicker genre of games. Not only do you unlock new heroes, you place them in formation (10 on screen at a time) and certain ones will interact with others causing bonuses to damage and such.   On top of that, there are the expected items to gain that boost damage and gold gains.   The biggest difference I noticed, between this one and Clicker Heroes, is that this one scrolls from left to right, as if the characters are walking through the forest or environment.   Additionally, if the monsters get to your heroes, they actually damage and can kill them for that round, causing you to need to go back a level and earn more gold.  The interface is great, easy to pickup and understand, and the gameplay is just fun.   There's also XP gain, which means that after 5 hours of having a hero in formation, their DPS will double due to XP gained. It's a small but nice touch.  There's really a lot to like about this game, and it's done something very right with its entering the clicker scene. Not only has it got its own charm and style, it sets itself apart enough from the crowd that it has managed to truly bring something new to the scene.  Certainly worth your download.
it's a fun game to play if you have time to waste.  it's still on beta but at least you get the chance to play it.

This game is so insanely mind-numbing, you wont even notice how much time it consumes before it is too late. And the worst part ? Its not even 'fun' .. you just watch some dudes walk .. it's just extremely addictive.  Why do I rate it 'positive' still ? Because sometimes people just need to watch some dudes walk in an extremely addictive and mind-numbing game.   Cheers
A fun little time waster. Good for watching Netflix and zoning out.

Okay, let's face it - if you have over 2500 hours of play time on record for a single game, it is probably kind of addictive. Of course, high play times are typical for idle games that are running in the background for hours because they need very little attention while playing - sometimes only a few mouse clicks per hour.  But to keep a player interested for many months the game needs some depth that is not usually found in free-to-play casual clicker idle games.  Well, yes, CotLI is a huge time waster, it is repetitive, and progress is achieved mainly by grinding. However, there are many good aspects combined in this game:  - ongoing expansion of permanent content in the game (new campaigns with higher difficulty for veterans) - frequent game events providing additional content for a few days (allowing to recruit new characters with different abilities) - temporary weekend buffs for a few crusaders that allow progressing faster and further in the game - strong strategic component depending on the formation and choice of crusaders that are currently used - both active (meaning: clicking) and passive (meaning: waiting) gameplay possible - different tactics can lead to success (optimizing high DPS, tanking, healing, gold find, etc.) - clever use of formation abilities can be far more effective than simply using the strongest crusaders) - earned Idols can be used to learn additional talents - Enchantment Points compensate the limited amount of crusader-specific items - Missions for crusaders that are currently not in use - funny ideas for campaigns and game events - ...  This is not bad at all for a free-to-play game! And even the pay-to-win aspect is rather discreet for such a game (purchasable items are a bit more effective than the best versions found for free in the game, but since you are using a formation of multiple crusaders, one item of one crusader alone usually makes not a big difference but it can accelerate the progress).  So if you're looking for a clicker idle game with some strategic depth and variety, this is the one! :-)

I find any clicker game additictive. I especially enjoy the 'adventure' aspect of Crusaders of the Lost Idols. The characters are likable. The powerups are decent. It's nice to be able to make decisions as to where to place heros for the maximum benefit.Treasure chests gotten from defeating bosses given even more benefits.

October 19th, 2015: The devs added in the account linking feature. Changed it to a recommend.  It's alright? I didn't know being able to transfer accounts for idle games was a norm, and the server-based save make it a no for me. Stick to the Kongregate version unless you're an achievement ♥♥♥♥♥.

Very well made game, could use some more variety for the monsters though :P
This is a time trap.  Don't play it.  Seek Jesus Christ.

Played this game a lot and enjoyed it (made my usual in-app purchase to support the devs as well), however it has more in-your-face money grab advertising than any other game like it. Each event that goes live dangles powerful items at you that are only obtainable with RL cash purchases of chests, the price of which has risen recently.  The game constantly reminds you of the purchases to be made each time you start it, they are constantly onscreen with popups to the right and the devs even like to email you about every new event and the new legendary item you can get for spending your money (these events occur very often).  I have started to feel tainted by this games greed and have now uninstalled it, unless the devs change their ways I will not be returning to it.  If you want good idle games look towards adventure capitalist, clicker heroes, idling to rule the gods, etc. They all offer these purchases but not in such a way as this game constantly does.

I wanted to like this game, but if the code is still so immature that my save is going to be wiped on random updates then you have absolutely ZERO business doing IAPs yet.  I'm left feeling like the money I paid was flushed down the toilet.  Uninstalled, never playing it again.

seems like a good game, just click n kill, passes the time. my problem is that the sreen doesnt fit on the laptop to be able to acces the buttons across the lower screen, even after hiding the task bar. and there is visible way to adjust the window. had to delete :(

An idle game with a new setting.. but does that mean better?  Not for me, but perhaps for the fans of the genre... The progress is very slow mostly because of important upgrade prices and minibosses (each 5 levels) requiring grind.  Waiting is long - as an example, being AFK for a day or two won't take you further than 5-10 levels. This kind of shows in the achievement ratios: 16% of players have achieved a 'reset', 8% have completed area 100 and rest of the achievements are done by very few.  I wouldn't recommend right now.

After playing actively for 2 hours, I cleared less than 40 levels, and didn't even unlock a single achievement. From looking at their list, it looks like I'm very, very far from even completing the 'beginning'. Okay. Maybe it works for you if you wanna spend thousands of hours on the game. I like my clickers light and fun. This one is fun, until you realize there's nothing else coming.  A thumb up for the formation system, a welcome addition for strategy, Most of the rest is just taken straight from earlier clicker games. Other than that, been there, done that, casual gaming won't come out stronger thanks to that game.
This is the end of gaming. No imagination, no challenge, no creativity. This is bull. Avoid like the plague!
